info.description: Welcome to Ringover's Public API Documentation. Ringover's REST API allows you to easily retrieve your phone information, access your contacts, users and groups and their properties. Our API is designed to answer your requests made via HTTP commands and to receive data with standard HTTP response codes.
info.title: Ringover Public API

tags.name: teams
tags.description:
The team object is a modelization of your Ringover's team. It contains a list of related objects:
- `numbers` and related information such as their type, country and prefix according to the country,
- `users` and related information such as their user ID, team ID as well as personal data such as their first name, last name and email, 
- `ivrs` and related information such as their ID and the `numbers` objects associated, 
- `conferences` and related information such as their ID, name and tags (optional)."

tags.name: groups
tags.description: The group object is a modelization of a group on Ringover. It contains basic data about the group like its name, color, number of users. It also indicates if people can join and leave freely.

tags.name: users
tags.description: The `user` object with our different routes allows you to retrieve data from one or all of your users, create new users or delete them. It contains basic data such as the user's first name, last name and email as well as all phone `numbers` attributed to the user.

tags.name: numbers
tags.description: The `number` object is a modelization of a phone number. Our different routes will allow you to retrieve data for all of your numbers or for one number specifically.

tags.name: ivrs
tags.description: The `ivr` (interactive voice response) object is a modelization of a Ringover ivr. It contains a list of objects like `numbers` and `scenario`. Our different API routes will allow you to retrieve all of this information.

tags.name: tags
tags.description: The `tags` object used on Ringover contains basic data like the tag id, its name, its color, a description and its creation date.

tags.name: conferences
tags.description: The `conference` object is a modelization of a conference that you created on Ringover. It contains an ID, a name and a list of `numbers` objects, which are the numbers used to join the conference.

tags.name: calls
tags.description: The call object is a modelization of your calls with Ringover. The API permits data retrieval for all of your current or past calls. Some routes are available with the HTTP GET and POST methods, the latter allowing you to use more parameters to refine the query.

tags.name: channels
tags.description: A `channel` is an audio stream during a call with Ringover.

tags.name: contacts
tags.description: The `contacts` object contains essential data as well as a list of all phone `numbers` attributed to the contact.

tags.name: conversations
tags.description: The `conversation` object is a modelization of a messaging conversation on Ringover. Regarding messages, only the last one is present in the structure of the object.

tags.name: messages
tags.description: The `messages` object refers to operations regarding messages such as listing the messages of a conversation or archiving/unarchiving a message.

tags.name: push
tags.description: The `push` object refers to operations regarding push SMS: a push SMS can be sent to a specific phone number.

tags.name: profiles
tags.description: The `profiles` object is a modelization of a user's profile created on Ringover. It contains two attributes : id (unique identifier of the profile) and name.

tags.name: presences
tags.description: The `presences` object retrieves information about a user like their planning, snooze status, connected device. It also allows you to know if they are in a call.

tags.name: blacklist
tags.description: The `blacklist` object contains information about your blacklisted phone numbers on Ringover.

tags.name: webhook
tags.description: Ringover uses webhooks to notify you any time that an event associated with your team occurs (ex: a new voicemail, the reception of a new message, a missed call...). A webhook is a URL that we call with a parameter that contains all the data about the event. It will allow you to create a webhook handler on your server in order to trigger specific actions in response to the event. You can configure your webhooks in the developer section of your Ringover's dashboard.

tags.name: callbacks
tags.description: The `callbacks` object refers to Telecoms' operations: it allows you to manage a call between a user and a recipient.

tags.name: surveys
tags.description: The `surveys` object allows you to retrieve the number of answered surveys and their contents.

tags.name: snoozes
tags.description: The `snoozes` object allows you to retrieve the list of snoozes status.

get.description: This request allows you to get a complete `team` object that contains a list of `numbers`, `users`, `ivrs`, `conferences`, `tags` and `groups`.

get.summary: Get all groups from your team
get.description: This request allows you to retrieve the 100 first groups from your team.

get.summary: Get a specified group from your team
get.description: This request allows you to retrieve data about a group.

patch.summary: Toggle free access to the group
patch.description: Toggle the `is_jumper` parameter of a specific group. It allows users to leave and join the group freely. This corresponds to the `Free access` switch of the group in the dashboard.

post.summary: Add a user to a group
post.description: This request allows you to add a user to a group. Make sure that it is possible to join the group freely (Free access switch).

delete.summary: Delete a user from a group
delete.description: This request allows you to delete a user from a group.

patch.description: This request allows you to patch the ring duration.

get.summary: Get all users from a team
get.description: This request allows you to retrieve all the users on your team, and a list of their numbers for each. The size of the list is set on the attribute `list_count`.

post.description: This request allows you to create a new user with or without commitment from their email address and phone number (E.164 format).

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve basic data about a user and all phone numbers assigned to them.

delete.description: This request allows you to delete permanently a user from their unique identifier.

post.description: This request allows you to update the user's profile by replacing it with the one corresponding to the id set in parameter.

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve a user's planning information.

put.description: This request allows you to replace a user's entire planning with a new one.

put.summary: Set user's planning of specific day
put.description: This request allows you to replace a user's day schedules with new ones.

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve a user's presences information.
This request allows you to get a user's snooze log

parameters.name: limit_count
parameters.description: Restrict the number of returned rows

parameters.name: limit_offset
parameters.description: The amount of conversations ignored, not returned

put.description: This request allows you to set a user's snooze status

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve the `numbers` list for your whole team. The size of the list is set in the variable list_count. You must have the admin's rights in order to use parameters.

parameters.name: is_user
parameters.description: Retrieves numbers belonging to a user

parameters.name: is_ivr
parameters.description: Retrieves numbers used for an ivr

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve information about an existing number. You simply have to set the phone numbers in the route (E.164 format).
This request allows you to retrieve all your ivrs. The size of the list is set in the variable list_count.
This request allows you to retrieve the ivr corresponding to the identifier indicated in the route.

get.summary: Get all scenarios from a specific ivr
get.description: This request allows you to retrieve all the scenarios attached to the ivr indicated in the route. The size of the list is set in the variable list_count.

get.summary: Get a scenario by id from a specific ivr
get.description: This request allows you to retrieve a scenario's information by indicating in the route its identifier and that of its ivr.
This request allows you to retrieve all your tags. The size of the list is set in the variable list_count.

post.description: This request allows you to create a tag.

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve the tag corresponding to the provided identifier.
This request allows you to retrieve all the conferences you've set up. The size of the list is indicated in the variable list_count.
This request allows you to retrieve a conference.

patch.description: This request allows you to update the pincode of the conference indicated in the parameter. You have to set parameters directly in the URL.

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve your terminated calls. All the parameters are optional. For a more refined search, please refer to the POST method.

parameters.name: start_date
parameters.description: Used to create a time cursor. Must be used with end_date

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Used to create a time cursor. Must be used with start_date

parameters.name: limit_count
parameters.description: Restrict the number of returned rows

parameters.name: last_id_returned
parameters.description: The request will return cdr_id (call logs) prior to this one

parameters.name: call_type
parameters.description: Used to filter certain types of call. 'ANSWERED' filters answered calls. 'MISSED' filters missed calls. 'OUT' filters outgoing calls. 'VOICEMAIL' filters calls ending on voicemail.

post.description: Here in POST method, this request is used to retrieves detailed data of your terminated calls. The object current_calls_filter must be set.

get.description: This request allows you to retrieve data about the terminated call set in the route parameter. The array list contains all the logs generated by the call, (for example in the case of call forwarding).

delete.description: This request allows you to archive a call (Rights monitoring enable = Dashboard effect | Rights monitoring disable = MyRingover effect).
This request allows you to archive a call with channelID (Rights monitoring enable = Dashboard effect | Rights monitoring disable = MyRingover effect).

get.summary: Get all survey answers for the callId indicated in the route

post.description: This request allows you to retrieve all currents calls. This route is only available with the POST method. The current_calls_filter object must be sent.

get.description: Retrieves your list of contacts. The maximum of rows returned is set in the parameter limit_count (limited to 1000 rows). All the parameters are optional.

parameters.name: pagination
parameters.description: The character sequence assigned to pages in address book. Possible values are: 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h', 'i', 'j', 'k', 'l', 'm', 'n', 'o', 'p', 'q', 'r', 's', 't', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x', 'y', 'z', '#' for any digit and '.' for any other characters. An empty value disables pagination.

parameters.name: alphabetical_order
parameters.description: Alphabetical order impacts on the pagination value. Possible values are : FirstnameLastnameCompanyDESC, FirstnameLastnameCompanyASC, LastnameFirstnameCompanyDESC, LastnameFirstnameCompanyASC, CompanyFirstnameLastnameDESC, CompanyFirstnameLastnameASC ,CompanyLastnameFirstnameDESC, CompanyLastnameFirstnameASC.

parameters.name: search
parameters.description: The keyword is used to search a specific contact. Index is based on firstname, lastname, company and phone number(s)

parameters.name: limit_count
parameters.description: Restrict the number of returned rows

parameters.name: limit_offset
parameters.description: The amount of conversations ignored, not returned

post.description: The function depends on the parameter that you sent, the JSON contact_filter to get all the contacts or contact_creation in order to create a new one. Only one parameter must be sent. In the case of creation, you can add multiple contacts at the same time, limited to 50 contacts in a row. In the other case, the maximum of contacts returned is set in the variable limit_count (limited to 1000 contacts).

requestBody.description: contact_filter for filter OR contact_create for creation

get.description: Retrieve data as well as all `numbers` to a specific `contact` by their identifier

put.description: Update the contact from their id. All fields are mandatory, except the array of numbers. If the array of numbers is set, then the numbers will be purged and replaced by those present in the parameter, otherwise no action will be taken for them.

delete.description: Delete the contact by their id

patch.summary: Update is_shared status for specific contact
patch.description: Toggle the attribute is_shared of the contact indicated in the parameter
Update the attributed firstname of the contact indicated in the parameter. You have to set the parameter directly in the URL.
Update the attributed lastname of the contact indicated in the parameter. You have to set the parameter directly in the URL.
Update the attributed company of the contact indicated in the parameter. You have to set the parameter directly in the URL.

post.summary: Add new number(s) for specific contact
post.description: Allow to add one or more numbers to the contact set in parameter. Phone numbers must be in international format.

delete.description: Delete permanently all phone numbers of the contact set in the route

put.summary: Update a number for specific contact
put.description: Update a phone number from the id and the phone number of the contact. The number in the API route is the old number, while the new number is in the json parameter. Phone numbers must be in E.164 format.

delete.description: Delete the phone number of the contact set in parameter

get.description: This will show the first 100 available conversations by default. When you provide a 'limit_offset' X with a 'limit_count' Y, the first X conversations will be ignored, and the following Y conversations will be returned.

parameters.name: limit_count
parameters.description: Restrict the number of returned rows

post.description: Only included in the Power pack. This API route is used to trigger a call between one of your users and a recipient. The from_number attributed is the phone number of your user while to_number is the number called by the user. Here is the call workflow: 1. Your user (from_number) receives a call from the recipient's number (to_number). 2. Your user picks up the phone > A call is automatically made to the recipient (to_number).
Only included in the Power pack. This API route is used to trigger a call in specific IVR queue

get.description: This request allows you to get the list of snooze labels in several languages if applicable.

post.description:
This event is triggered when a customer answers a response code from an IVR scenario: 
1. Ringover sends you information about an event.
2. You send an HTTP code according to this information (for instance, 200 if it is a successful operation).
3. An IVR with an "Ask for a code" scenario can be created with various HTTP codes and according to the code you return, an event is triggered (recording, redirection, etc.).

> Warning: Announcements must be set in the IVR in order for this webhook to be operational.

This event is triggered when a message is sent and/or received (according to your settings on the myringover dashboard). The data object contained in the sent object will give you information such as the sending number, the receiving number, the content of the message, the time it was sent etc...

The Smart routing webhook event is a little more tricky because the webhook requires a response from you within two seconds. When the webhook lands on your endpoint, your endpoint must communicate the response object below. We advise you to consult the description of each attribute, which are all mandatory. This event can apply to an IVR.

Webhook sent on each call (incoming and outgoing), it will allow you to transmit notes to the agent. The notes are located next to the contact's photo, in the information bubble of the call window. You can set custom information in the data object (refer to the object below).
The webhook is triggered during a search on myringover (in the smartdialer, on contacts tabs, ...). In order to get from your API the contact's informations and numbers.

Incoming call webhook, triggered when you receive a call. You will retrieve all the call's information and if it's to a voice server, you'll also have the information related to it in the object ivr_data.
Incoming call webhook, triggered when you answer a call
Terminated call webhook, when you hang up a call
This webhook is triggered when an incoming call is missed
This webhook is triggered when you get a new voicemail
This webhook is triggered when a comment is updated
This webhook is triggered when a tag is updated
This webhook is triggered when a record is available
This webhook is triggered when a voicemail is available

Authorization.description:
We use API keys for authentication to authorize API requests. First, you need to create a public access token (API key) and select the appropriate rights for each user. To do so:
  1. Open the Ringover Dashboard.
  2. Go to the **Developer** section.
  3. Click the **Create an API key** button.
  4. Select a user in the drop-down menu and enter a label for the key and click the **Create** button.
  5. Click the **Edit** button corresponding to the API key and select the appropriate rights.

Once you've created a public access token, you can use it in the 'Authorization' header to authenticate your HTTP request.
Authorization.name: Authorization

team_id.description: The team identifier of the user

ring_duration.description: Ring duration when an IVR incoming call append

order.description: The order in the ivr queue

total_users_count.description: The number of users in the group

tz_now.description: Current timestamp of the user's timezone

planning_enable.description: True if the user have the planning option activated on myringover

is_planning.description: True if the user is currently in his planning schedule

is_snooze.description: True if the user is currently in snooze

time_ranges.description: Array of all the user's schedules. time_ranges is null if planning_enable is equal to false

day.description: Day of the week (0 => Monday, 6 => Sunday)

in_call.description: Number of current calls (it can be more than 1)

connected_devices.description: Number of devices connected to myringover

planning_enable.description: True if the user have the planning option activated on myringover

is_planning.description: True if the user is currently in his planning schedule

is_planned_snooze.description: False if the user is currently in his planning schedule

is_snooze.description: True if the user is currently in snooze

snooze_type.description: The type of snooze currently used. Null if is_snooze is false

total_count.description: The total number of survey answers retrieved

survey_list.description: Array containing the different survey answers for the given call

limit_count_setted.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

limit_offset_setted.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

last_id_offset_setted.description: The request will return cdr_id (call logs) prior to this one

call_list_count.description: The size of the array list, corresponds to the number of logs retrieved

call_list.description: Array containing the different logs generated by the call (for example in case of transfer)

filter.description: 'ALL' filter displays all calls. 'DIRECT' filter does not display any IVR calls. 'IVR' filter displays all IVR calls. 'ADVANCED' filter allows you to define advanced filters.

start_date.description: Used to create a time cursor. Must be used with end_date.

end_date.description: Used to create a time cursor. Must be used with start_date.

call_type.description: Used to filter certain types of calls. 'ANSWERED' filters answered calls. 'MISSED' filters missed calls. 'OUT' filters outgoing calls. 'VOICEMAIL' filters calls ending on voicemail.

advanced.description: Only used with advanced filter. Offer the possibility of filtering for specific IVR(s) or Group(s)/User(s).

ivrs.description: Cannot be combined with group/user filters. Used to filter calls for specific IVR(s).

groups.description: Cannot be combined with ivr filters. Used to filter calls for specific Group(s).

users.description: Cannot be combined with ivr filters. Used to filter calls for specific User(s).

ext_numbers.description: Used to filter external numbers (E164 without \'+\' format).

int_numbers.description: Used to filter internal numbers (E164 without \'+\' format).

tags.description: Used to filter tags ID

intra.description: Show OR exclude intra-Ringover calls only

out_planning.description: Show OR exclude calls received outside of working hours

no_digit.description: Show OR exclude calls where no digit was pressed

ringing.description: Show OR exclude calls that did not ring to any user

note.description: Show OR exclude calls with note

tag.description: Show OR exclude calls with tag(s)

short.description: Required: 'exclude_short_value'. Show OR exclude the 'exclude_short_value' filter.

long.description: Required: 'exclude_long_value'. Show OR exclude the 'exclude_long_value' filter.

amd.description: Show OR exclude calls answered by a 'machine'

exclude_short_value.description: Used to filter calls lasting under X seconds

exclude_long_value.description: Used to filter calls lasting over X seconds

limit_count.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

limit_offset.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

last_id_returned.description: The request will return cdr_id (call logs) prior to this one

advanced.description: Only used with advanced filter. Offer the possibility of filtering for specific IVR(s) or Group(s)/User(s).

ivrs.description: Cannot be combined with groups/user filters. Used to filter calls for specific IVR(s).

groups.description: Cannot be combined with ivr filters. Used to filter calls for specific Group(s).

users.description: Cannot be combined with ivrs filters. Used to filter calls for specific User(s).

limit_count.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

limit_offset.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

from_number.description: Unknown displays when someone uses a masked number.

pagination.description: The character sequence assigned to pages in address book. Possible values are: 'a', 'b', 'c', 'd', 'e', 'f', 'g', 'h', 'i', 'j', 'k', 'l', 'm', 'n', 'o', 'p', 'q', 'r', 's', 't', 'u', 'v', 'w', 'x', 'y', 'z', '#' for any digit and '.' for any other characters. An empty value disables pagination.

alphabetical_order.description: Alphabetical order impacts the pagination value. Possible values are : FirstnameLastnameCompanyDESC, FirstnameLastnameCompanyASC, LastnameFirstnameCompanyDESC, LastnameFirstnameCompanyASC, CompanyFirstnameLastnameDESC, CompanyFirstnameLastnameASC ,CompanyLastnameFirstnameDESC, CompanyLastnameFirstnameASC

search.description: The keyword is used to search a specific contact. Index is based on firstname, lastname, company and phone number(s).

limit_count.description: Used to create a pagination cursor

limit_offset.description: The request will not return user_id (call logs) prior to this one

list_member.description: This field is used when the flag marged is turn on

list_internal_member.description: This field is used when the flag marged is turn off

list_external_member.description: This field is used when the flag marged is turn off

list_count.description: The size of the array list, corresponds to the number of profiles retrieved
The size of the array list, corresponds to the number of presences retrieved

total_blacklist_count.description: The total number of blacklisted phone numbers

blacklist_list_count.description: The size of the array blacklist_list, corresponds to the number of blacklisted phone numbers retrieved.

comment.description: The comment about this blacklisted number, can be null.
A comment about this blacklisted number

max_attempts.description: The number of times the agent loop will be executed.

start_delay.description: The delay before the first ring.

is_stay_not_connected.description:
If the agent is disconnected:
0: Skip that agent and move on to the next one.
1: Wait for the agent to log on and send them the call.

is_stay_in_call.description:
If the agent already has a call in progress:
0: Skip that agent and move on to the next one.
1: Wait for the agent to finish and send them the call.

is_stay_planned_snoozed.description:
If outside of the agents scheduled hours:
0: Skip that agent and move on to the next one.
1: Puts the caller on hold until the agent enters their scheduled hours then calls them.

is_stay_snoozed.description:
If the agent is in snooze:
0: Skip that agent and move on to the next one.
1: Puts the caller on hold until the agent's snooze period ends, then calls them.

ring_overlap.description:
When the ring_delay of an agent ends and the next one is called, should we keep ringing the first one?
0: No
1: Yes

agent_type.description:
Agent type and identification means.
This field is used to explain how to use this object, BUT not need to put it.

order.description: Position in the queue of agents.

number.description: Agent's phone number, in international format.

is_caller_id.description:
Which number should we display to the agent ?
0: The IVR's number.
1: The caller's number.

is_head_line.description:
What should we do if this external agent is already in call?
0: Wait for his call to end.
1: Force the call (he will receive a dual call).

is_internal.description: The call is coming from an internal number.

is_ivr.description: The call is coming from an IVR.

record.description: Set only when the feature was activated

tags.description: New tag

clir.description: Calling line identification restriction: The CLIR service blocks calling party address information from being presented to the called user.

timeout.description: Number of seconds before the call is aborted if the communication isn't etablished.
Number of seconds before abort the call if the communication isn't etablished.

snooze_log_list_count.description: The size of the array list, corresponds to the number of logs retrieved

total_snooze_log_count.description: The total number of snooze logs

name.description: The name of the campaign CALL List

purpose.description: The purpose of the campaign CALL List
purpose.example: My campaign CALL List is sent to people to improve my business

max_retry.description: The max retry attempts for numbers in the campaign CALL List

total_archive_logs.description: The size of archive log array

total_start_logs.description: The size of start log array

total_campaign_calllist_count.description: The count of all active campaigns calllist (NOT including archived and NOT stopped by user)

campaign_calllist_list.description: The list of all campaigns calllist (including archived and stopped)

campaign_calllist_list_count.description: The count of all campaigns calllist (including archived and stopped)

to_numbers.description: The list of mobile phone numbers

numbers_list.description: The list of campaign calllist numbers
